section.heading: Enrollment Required.
section.text: A participating employer is required to enroll an employee who is a member of a State system as a condition of employment from the first day of employment.

section.heading: Enrollment Procedure.
section.text: Enrollment shall consist of the participating employer submitting the following completed forms to the Retirement Agency:

para.text: An Application for Membership that is completed in accordance with the form’s instructions;
Proof of birth as set forth in COMAR 22.01.05.02; and
A copy of the employee's job description:
For an employee who is to be enrolled:
In the Law Enforcement Officers’ Pension System;
In the State Police Retirement System; or
If employed by a participating governmental unit, in the Correctional Officers’ Retirement System; or
Upon request by the Retirement Agency.

section.heading: Imposition of Penalty Procedure.
section.text: Based on the enrollment records as of June 30 of each fiscal year, the Retirement Agency shall impose a penalty of $100 per employee per year on a participating employer for any employee who:

para.text: Began employment with the participating employer:
Before April 1 of the same fiscal year; or
Is a member of the State system as a condition of employment; and
Has not been properly enrolled in accordance with Regulation .02 of this chapter.

section.heading: Due Date for Payment of Penalty.
section.text: Payment of the penalty is due within 30 days of the date of the invoice.
